intro: Spermacoce kirkii, commonly known as the African star apple, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that splits open to release its seeds. The plant is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
